Key Match Events: Alex Verdugo drove in the go-ahead run with a weak grounder to shortstop that Cleveland Guardians shortstop Brayan Rocchio couldn’t field cleanly in the ninth inning.
The New York Yankees won 8–6 in Game 4 of the American League Championship Series to move one victory from the World Series.
Gleyber Torres followed with a single to center field to drive in Anthony Volpe and boost the Yankees’ lead.
Emmanuel Clase gave up consecutive singles to Rizzo and Volpe in the ninth inning.
Cleveland brought the game-winning run to the plate in the bottom of the ninth when Jhonkensy Noel drew a one-out walk and Andres Gimenez singled.
Bo Naylor flied out to center field, and Rocchio grounded out to second to end the game.
Giancarlo Stanton crushed a three-run homer, building the Yankees' lead to 6–2.
Jose Ramirez drove in Brayan Rocchio with a one-out double, then Josh Naylor followed with another double that scored Steven Kwan and Ramirez.
David Fry did it again with a grounder toward first base, which was fielded by Mark Leiter Jr., allowing Bo Naylor to score the tying run.
Mark Leiter Jr. was added to the Yankees’ ALCS roster as an injury replacement for Ian Hamilton.
Tanner Bibee will start Game 5 with the Guardians' season at stake. Carlos Rodon gets the starting nod for the Yankees on Saturday.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The manager highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
The Yankees moved one victory from the World Series with a win on Saturday.
Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
New York can clinch the AL pennant and a trip to the World Series with a win on Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mark Leiter Jr. strikes out Josh Naylor to keep the game tied.
The game went into the ninth inning with a tied score of 6–6.
The Yankees ended a 20-year championship drought.
